verses.text: 其他使徒接納保羅過了十四年，我再次上耶路撒冷去，這次是和巴拿巴，並且帶著提多一同去的。

words.note: Lit. 'sent disciple'.

verses.text: 我是順從啟示去的；在那裡我對他們說明我在外族人中所傳的福音，私下講了給那些有名望的人聽，免得我從前或現在都白跑了。

words.note: To open and reveal.
Indicates manner or purpose of action.
Refers to non-Jewish people.
Forms a noun phrase from a verb or verb phrase.
Lit. 'blessed news'.
Lit. 'run for nothing'.

verses.text: 與我同行的提多，雖然是希臘人，也沒有強迫他受割禮；

words.note: Lit. 'cutting ritual'.

verses.text: 這是因為有些混進來的假弟兄，暗暗地來偵查我們在基督耶穌裡享有的自由，為的是要轄制我們。

words.note: A directional verb compound: mix + enter + come.
Commonly used for fellow believers.
Reduplication for emphasis on 'secret'.
Often followed by 是 to emphasize purpose.

verses.text: 對這些人，我們一點也沒有讓步妥協，為了要使福音的真理存留在你們中間。

words.definition: not at all, not even a bit
words.note: Used with negation (沒有) to emphasize 'not at all'.
Lit. 'yield a step'.
Lit. 'blessed news'.

verses.text: 至於那些被認為有名望的人，他們並沒有給我增加甚麼；

words.note: Lit. 'take people', implies judging by appearance or showing favoritism.
Used here to emphasize the negative following.

verses.text: 反而因為看見我受託傳福音給沒有受割禮的人，就像彼得受託傳福音給受割禮的人一樣，

words.note: Refers to the Jewish practice of circumcision.

verses.text: （因為運行在彼得裡面，使他作受割禮者的使徒的那一位，也運行在我裡面，使我作外族人的使徒，）

words.note: Often refers to divine activity or the Spirit's work.
Refers to Jewish believers or the Jewish people.
Refers to God or the Holy Spirit.
Often refers to divine activity or the Spirit's work.
Refers to people who are not Jewish.

verses.text: 又知道我蒙了 神的恩，那幾位被譽為柱石的雅各、磯法和約翰，就向我和巴拿巴伸出右手互相許諾，我們要到外族人那裡去傳福音，他們要到受割禮的人那裡去傳福音；

words.note: Often used for receiving blessings or grace from a higher power.
Used metaphorically for a foundational leader or support.

verses.text: 只是要我們記念窮人，這本來也是我一向熱心作的。

words.note: 熱心 means enthusiastic/zealous. 熱心作 means to do with zeal.

verses.text: 彼得受責備可是，磯法到了安提阿的時候，因為他有該責備的地方，我就當面反對他。

words.note: Can mean 'place' or 'aspect/area'

verses.text: 從雅各那裡來的人還沒有到以前，他和外族人一同吃飯；但他們來到了，他因為怕那些守割禮的人，就從外族人中退出來，和他們分開。

words.note: Refers to non-Jewish people.
A Jewish religious rite.

verses.text: 其餘的猶太人也和他一同裝假，甚至連巴拿巴也受了影響，跟著他們裝假。

words.note: Refers to people of Judea, followers of Judaism.
Used with 也/都 to emphasize an extreme case.

verses.text: 但我一見他們所行的不合福音的真理，就當眾對磯法說：「你是猶太人，生活既然像外族人而不像猶太人，怎麼還勉強外族人跟隨猶太人的規矩呢？」

words.note: Often used in '一...就...' structure.
Indicates the object of the verb.
Lit. 'blessed news'.

verses.text: 因信稱義我們生來是猶太人，不是外族中的罪人；

words.note: A key theological term meaning 'declared righteous by God'.
Refers to non-Jewish ethnic groups.

verses.text: 既然知道人稱義不是靠行律法，而是因信耶穌基督，我們也就信了基督耶穌，使我們因信基督稱義，不是靠行律法；因為沒有人能靠行律法稱義。

words.note: A key theological term meaning to be declared righteous by God.
Refers to the Mosaic Law or legalism in general.
Can be a verb 'to believe' or noun 'faith'.
Here used as a noun 'faith'.

verses.text: 如果我們尋求在基督裡稱義，卻仍然是罪人，難道基督是使人犯罪的嗎？絕對不是。

words.note: Often combined with 在 (zài) to mean 'inside of'.
A person who commits sin.
Used for rhetorical questions, implying the answer is 'no'.
A common verb-object compound in religious contexts.
Functions here to nominalize the preceding phrase.

verses.text: 我若重建我所拆毀的，就證明自己是個有過犯的人。

words.note: A more formal or literary 'if' than '如果'.
Used before a verb to form a nominal phrase, 'that which is V-ed'.
Nominalizer, making 'that which I tore down'.
Classifier for people and general items.
Refers to a violation of moral or divine law.
Connects an adjective/phrase to a noun.

verses.text: 我藉著律法已經向律法死了，使我可以向 神活著。

words.note: Refers to the divine being, God.

verses.text: 我已經與基督同釘十字架；現在活著的，不再是我，而是基督活在我裡面；如今在肉身中活著的我，是因信 神的兒子而活的；他愛我，為我捨己。

words.note: More formal than '跟 (gēn)' for 'with'.
A compound verb specifically referring to being nailed (to the cross) together with.
Literally 'ten-character frame', referring to the shape of the cross.
Nominalizer, making 'the one who is living'.
Refers to the physical body, often with a spiritual implication.
Nominalizer, making 'the living me'.
Here used as a noun 'faith'.
Here refers to Jesus as the Son of God.
Indicates result or consequence.
Emphasizes the preceding clause as the manner or reason for living.

words.definition: to deny oneself, to sacrifice oneself
words.note: A core Christian concept of self-sacrifice.

verses.text: 我不廢棄 神的恩；如果義是藉著律法而來的，基督就白白地死了。

words.note: The leading space is a traditional sign of reverence for God in Chinese Bibles.
Refers to theological righteousness in this context.
Refers to Mosaic Law.
Used to nominalize the preceding phrase.
Indicates completion or change of state.
